name: Vegan Bibimbap
description: Making bibimbap at home is super easy! This vegan bibimbap comes together pretty quickly and you can prepare most of the ingredients in advance. It's a Korean classic that is packed with flavor and color - all in one bowl!
recipeIngredient: about 5 radishes, cut into thin slices
1  clove of garlic, cut into thin slices

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Gojuchang sauce. Place the gochujang paste, the sesame oil, the rice vinegar, and the maple syrup in a small bowl and stir well.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the Gojuchang sauce. Place the gochujang paste, the sesame oil, the rice vinegar, and the maple syrup in a small bowl and stir well.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the rice according to the instructions on the package.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the rice according to the instructions on the package.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the carrots and the cucumber and grate. Slice the mushrooms and the radishes. Cut the green onions into rings. Cut the garlic into thin slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel the carrots and the cucumber and grate. Slice the mushrooms and the radishes. Cut the green onions into rings. Cut the garlic into thin slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the tofu and pat it dry with paper towel. Cut the tofu into cubes. Roll the tofu cubes in corn starch.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the tofu and pat it dry with paper towel. Cut the tofu into cubes. Roll the tofu cubes in corn starch.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the sesame oil in a large pan and fry the tofu for about 4 minutes. Add one teaspoon of soy sauce and cook for another minute. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of sesame seeds. Put aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the sesame oil in a large pan and fry the tofu for about 4 minutes. Add one teaspoon of soy sauce and cook for another minute. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of sesame seeds. Put aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan, cook the mushrooms on high heat for about 5 minutes. After 3 minutes add the garlic. Deglaze with one teaspoon of soy sauce. Set aside. Add some water in the pan (about 2 tablespoons), add the spinach, and put a lid on the pan. Cook for about 2 minutes or until the spinach wilts. Season with salt and cayenne pepper and add another 1/2 teaspoon of soy sauce. Sprinkle with one teaspoon of sesame seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: In the same pan, cook the mushrooms on high heat for about 5 minutes. After 3 minutes add the garlic. Deglaze with one teaspoon of soy sauce. Set aside. Add some water in the pan (about 2 tablespoons), add the spinach, and put a lid on the pan. Cook for about 2 minutes or until the spinach wilts. Season with salt and cayenne pepper and add another 1/2 teaspoon of soy sauce. Sprinkle with one teaspoon of sesame seeds.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve everything in a bowl together with the rice and the gochujang sauce. Sprinkle with the remaining sesame seeds. Enjoy!
